storyTitle: As Schedule Coordinator, I want to perform schedule change request submission to achieve accurate and complete change requests

testCases.title: Validate successful schedule change request submission with valid data
preconditions: User is authenticated as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change request submission page is accessible
Valid attachment file is available for upload (PDF, DOC, or DOCX format, max 10MB)

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request submission page
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields including schedule date, time, reason, and optional attachment upload field

steps.action: Enter valid schedule date in the date field
steps.expectedResult: Date field accepts the input and displays the selected date without validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid time in the time field
steps.expectedResult: Time field accepts the input and displays the selected time without validation errors

steps.action: Enter a valid reason for the schedule change in the reason text field
steps.expectedResult: Reason field accepts the text input without validation errors

steps.action: Click on the attachment upload button and select a valid document file
steps.expectedResult: File upload dialog opens, file is selected and uploaded successfully, file name is displayed in the attachment field

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: System validates all inputs, processes the submission within 2 seconds, saves the request to ScheduleChangeRequests table, and displays a confirmation message with the request ID and timestamp

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in the database with status 'Submitted'
Submission is timestamped and logged in the system
Attachment is stored and associated with the request
User remains on confirmation page or is redirected to requests dashboard

testCases.title: Verify rejection of submission with missing mandatory fields
preconditions: User is authenticated as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change request submission page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request submission page
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields marked with asterisks or required indicators

steps.action: Leave the schedule date field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without pre-filled data

steps.action: Leave the time field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without pre-filled data

steps.action: Leave the reason field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without pre-filled data

steps.action: Click the Submit button without filling mandatory fields
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation errors are displayed next to each empty mandatory field with user-friendly error messages (e.g., 'Schedule date is required', 'Time is required', 'Reason is required'), submission is blocked, and no data is sent to the server

steps.action: Fill in the schedule date field with a valid date
steps.expectedResult: Date field accepts the input and the validation error for this field is cleared

steps.action: Fill in the time field with a valid time
steps.expectedResult: Time field accepts the input and the validation error for this field is cleared

steps.action: Fill in the reason field with a valid reason
steps.expectedResult: Reason field accepts the input and the validation error for this field is cleared

steps.action: Click the Submit button again with all mandatory fields completed
steps.expectedResult: System validates all inputs successfully, processes the submission within 2 seconds, saves the request, and displays a confirmation message with the request ID and timestamp

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in the database only after all mandatory fields are filled
Submission is timestamped and logged in the system
User sees confirmation of successful submission

testCases.title: Test attachment upload functionality
preconditions: User is authenticated as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change request submission page is accessible
Valid document file is available for upload (PDF format, size less than 10MB)

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request submission page
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with attachment upload option visible and enabled

steps.action: Click on the attachment upload button or drag-and-drop area
steps.expectedResult: File selection dialog opens allowing user to browse and select files

steps.action: Select a valid document attachment (e.g., PDF file within size limits)
steps.expectedResult: File is uploaded successfully, attachment file name is displayed in the form, file size is shown, and a preview or icon indicating successful upload is displayed

steps.action: Fill in all mandatory fields (schedule date, time, and reason) with valid data
steps.expectedResult: All mandatory fields accept the input without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: System validates all inputs including the attachment, processes the submission within 2 seconds, saves the request with the attachment linked to it, and displays a confirmation message

steps.action: Verify the attachment is associated with the schedule change request by checking the request details or database
steps.expectedResult: Attachment is saved in the Attachments storage, properly linked to the schedule change request ID, and is retrievable

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in the database with status 'Submitted'
Attachment file is stored in the Attachments storage system
Attachment is linked to the schedule change request via request ID
User can view the attached document in the request details

storyTitle: As Schedule Coordinator, I want to perform viewing of schedule change request status to achieve transparency in approval progress

testCases.title: Validate display of user's schedule change requests
preconditions: User is authenticated as Schedule Coordinator
User has previously submitted at least 3 schedule change requests
Schedule change requests have different statuses (e.g., Pending, Approved, Rejected)
User has permissions to view their own schedule change requests

steps.action: Schedule Coordinator logs into the system using valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard or home page

steps.action: Navigate to 'My Schedule Change Requests' page from the main menu or dashboard
steps.expectedResult: 'My Schedule Change Requests' dashboard is displayed within 3 seconds, showing a list view of all schedule change requests

steps.action: View the list of submitted schedule change requests
steps.expectedResult: All requests submitted by the logged-in user are listed with columns showing request ID, schedule date, time, reason, current status, and submission date

steps.action: Verify that each request displays its current status (e.g., Pending, Approved, Rejected, In Review)
steps.expectedResult: Each request in the list shows its current status clearly with appropriate visual indicators (e.g., color coding or status badges)

steps.action: Click on one of the schedule change requests to view details
steps.expectedResult: Detailed view page opens showing complete request information including schedule date, time, reason, attachments, current status, and approval history section

steps.action: Review the approval history and comments section
steps.expectedResult: Detailed approval history is displayed showing all approval actions taken, approver names, timestamps, decision (approved/rejected/pending), and any comments provided by approvers in chronological order

postconditions: User remains on the detailed view page
All request data is displayed accurately
User can navigate back to the list view
No unauthorized data is exposed

testCases.title: Verify filtering and sorting functionality
preconditions: User is authenticated as Schedule Coordinator
User has submitted multiple schedule change requests with various statuses (Pending, Approved, Rejected)
User is on the 'My Schedule Change Requests' dashboard page
At least one request has status 'Pending'

steps.action: Locate the filter options on the 'My Schedule Change Requests' dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Filter controls are visible, including status filter dropdown and date range filters

steps.action: Click on the status filter dropdown and select 'Pending'
steps.expectedResult: Filter is applied and only schedule change requests with status 'Pending' are displayed in the list, other statuses are hidden

steps.action: Verify the count of displayed requests matches the number of pending requests
steps.expectedResult: The number of requests shown corresponds to the actual number of pending requests, and a filter indicator shows 'Filtered by: Status = Pending'

steps.action: Locate the sort options and click on the 'Submission Date' column header to sort in descending order
steps.expectedResult: Requests are reordered from newest to oldest based on submission date, with the most recent submission appearing first, and a descending sort indicator (down arrow) is displayed

steps.action: Verify the order of requests by checking submission dates
steps.expectedResult: All displayed requests are ordered correctly with the newest submission date at the top and oldest at the bottom

steps.action: Click the 'Clear Filters' or 'Reset' button
steps.expectedResult: All filters and sorting are removed, and all schedule change requests submitted by the user are displayed in the default order (typically by submission date descending or request ID)

steps.action: Verify all requests are now visible
steps.expectedResult: The complete list of all user's schedule change requests is displayed without any filters applied

postconditions: Filters and sorting are cleared
All user's requests are visible
Dashboard is in default state
User can apply new filters or sorting as needed

testCases.title: Test access restriction to own requests
preconditions: User is authenticated as Schedule Coordinator
Another Schedule Coordinator user exists in the system with their own schedule change requests
User knows or can obtain the request ID or URL of another user's schedule change request
Security controls are implemented to restrict access to own requests only

steps.action: Obtain the URL or request ID of a schedule change request belonging to another user
steps.expectedResult: URL or request ID is available for testing (e.g., /api/schedule-change-requests/12345 where 12345 belongs to another user)

steps.action: Attempt to access another user's schedule change request by directly entering the URL in the browser or manipulating the request ID parameter
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays an 'Access Denied' error message, or returns a 403 Forbidden status, or redirects to an error page, or displays no data with a message 'Request not found'

steps.action: Verify that no sensitive data from the other user's request is displayed or leaked in the response
steps.expectedResult: No details of the other user's schedule change request are visible, and no sensitive information is exposed in the error message or page source

steps.action: Navigate back to 'My Schedule Change Requests' dashboard using the normal navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: User is returned to their own dashboard showing only their own schedule change requests

steps.action: Select and view one of the user's own schedule change requests
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed successfully with full approval history and comments, confirming normal access to own requests is working

steps.action: Verify that all displayed requests belong to the logged-in user by checking the submitter information
steps.expectedResult: All requests shown are confirmed to be submitted by the current logged-in user, with no requests from other users visible

postconditions: User can only access their own schedule change requests
Security controls are verified to be working correctly
No unauthorized data access occurred
System maintains data privacy and access restrictions

storyTitle: As Schedule Coordinator, I want to perform editing of submitted schedule change requests to achieve correction of errors before approval

testCases.title: Validate editing of pending schedule change request
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
At least one schedule change request exists in pending status
User has permission to edit own schedule change requests
ScheduleChangeRequests table is accessible
Audit logging system is operational

steps.action: Navigate to 'My Schedule Change Requests' page
steps.expectedResult: Page loads successfully displaying list of schedule change requests

steps.action: Locate and select a pending schedule change request from the list
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed with edit option visible and enabled

steps.action: Click the edit button to enter edit mode
steps.expectedResult: Request form opens in edit mode with all fields populated with current values

steps.action: Modify schedule details (e.g., change date, time, or reason)
steps.expectedResult: Modified values are accepted in the form fields without errors

steps.action: Click save button to submit changes
steps.expectedResult: Changes are saved successfully, confirmation message displayed, and submission timestamp is updated to current date/time

steps.action: Navigate to audit log section or view audit trail for the request
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays the edit action with coordinator username, timestamp, and details of changes made

steps.action: Verify the update response time
steps.expectedResult: System processes and saves the update within 2 seconds

postconditions: Schedule change request remains in pending status with updated details
Submission timestamp reflects the time of the edit
Audit log contains complete record of the edit action
Original request data is preserved in audit history

testCases.title: Verify editing is blocked for approved requests
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
At least one schedule change request exists in approved status
User has permission to view schedule change requests
Security rules are properly configured to restrict editing of approved requests

steps.action: Navigate to 'My Schedule Change Requests' page
steps.expectedResult: Page loads successfully displaying list of schedule change requests including approved ones

steps.action: Locate and select an approved schedule change request from the list
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed

steps.action: Attempt to access the edit functionality for the approved request
steps.expectedResult: Edit option is disabled, grayed out, or not visible for approved requests

steps.action: If edit button is visible, click it to attempt editing
steps.expectedResult: System displays access denied message or error notification indicating editing is not allowed for approved requests

steps.action: Attempt direct API call to PUT /api/schedule-change-requests/{id} for approved request (if applicable)
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden or appropriate error response preventing the edit

postconditions: Approved request remains unchanged
No audit log entry is created for failed edit attempt
Request status remains as approved

testCases.title: Test validation prevents saving invalid edits
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
At least one schedule change request exists in pending status
Validation rules are configured for schedule change request fields
User has permission to edit own schedule change requests

steps.action: Navigate to 'My Schedule Change Requests' page
steps.expectedResult: Page loads successfully displaying list of schedule change requests

steps.action: Select a pending schedule change request and click edit
steps.expectedResult: Request form opens in edit mode with current values populated

steps.action: Enter invalid data in one or more required fields (e.g., past date, empty required field, invalid format)
steps.expectedResult: Form accepts the input temporarily for validation testing

steps.action: Click save button to attempt saving invalid data
steps.expectedResult: Validation errors are displayed next to invalid fields with clear error messages, save operation is blocked, and form remains in edit mode

steps.action: Verify that no changes were saved to the database
steps.expectedResult: Original request data remains unchanged, submission timestamp is not updated

steps.action: Correct the invalid data by entering valid values in all fields
steps.expectedResult: Validation errors clear as valid data is entered

steps.action: Click save button with corrected valid data
steps.expectedResult: Changes are saved successfully, confirmation message displayed, and submission timestamp is updated

steps.action: Verify audit log for the successful save
steps.expectedResult: Audit log shows only the successful edit action with user and timestamp, no record of failed validation attempt

postconditions: Schedule change request contains valid updated data
Request remains in pending status
Submission timestamp reflects the successful edit time
Audit log contains record of successful edit only

storyTitle: As Schedule Coordinator, I want to perform cancellation of schedule change requests to achieve withdrawal of requests before approval

testCases.title: Validate cancellation of pending schedule change request
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
At least one schedule change request exists in pending status
User has permission to cancel own schedule change requests
Approvers are assigned to the schedule change request
Notification system is operational
Audit logging system is operational

steps.action: Navigate to 'My Schedule Change Requests' page
steps.expectedResult: Page loads successfully displaying list of schedule change requests

steps.action: Locate and select a pending schedule change request from the list
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed with cancel option visible and enabled

steps.action: Click the cancel button
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears asking user to confirm the cancellation action with message like 'Are you sure you want to cancel this request?'

steps.action: Click confirm button in the confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: Request status is updated to 'cancelled', confirmation message is displayed to user (e.g., 'Request successfully cancelled')

steps.action: Verify the cancellation processing time
steps.expectedResult: Cancellation is processed and confirmed within 2 seconds

steps.action: Refresh the request list or view the cancelled request details
steps.expectedResult: Request status shows as 'cancelled' and cancel option is no longer available

steps.action: Navigate to audit log section or view audit trail for the request
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays the cancellation action with coordinator username, timestamp, and cancellation details

steps.action: Verify notification was sent to approvers (check notification queue or approver inbox)
steps.expectedResult: Notification has been sent to all assigned approvers informing them of the cancellation

postconditions: Schedule change request status is set to 'cancelled'
Request cannot be edited or cancelled again
Audit log contains complete record of cancellation action
Approvers have been notified of the cancellation
Request is no longer in pending approval queue

testCases.title: Verify cancellation blocked for approved requests
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
At least one schedule change request exists in approved status
User has permission to view schedule change requests
Security rules are properly configured to restrict cancellation of approved requests

steps.action: Navigate to 'My Schedule Change Requests' page
steps.expectedResult: Page loads successfully displaying list of schedule change requests including approved ones

steps.action: Locate and select an approved schedule change request from the list
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed showing approved status

steps.action: Attempt to access the cancel functionality for the approved request
steps.expectedResult: Cancel option is disabled, grayed out, or not visible for approved requests

steps.action: If cancel button is visible, click it to attempt cancellation
steps.expectedResult: System displays access denied message or error notification indicating cancellation is not allowed for approved requests

steps.action: Attempt direct API call to POST /api/schedule-change-requests/{id}/cancel for approved request (if applicable)
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden or appropriate error response preventing the cancellation

steps.action: Verify request status remains unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Request status remains as 'approved' with no modifications

postconditions: Approved request remains unchanged with approved status
No audit log entry is created for failed cancellation attempt
No notifications are sent to approvers
Request remains in approved state

testCases.title: Test notification sent to approvers upon cancellation
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
At least one schedule change request exists in pending status
One or more approvers are assigned to the request
Notification system is configured and operational
User has permission to cancel own schedule change requests
Ability to verify notification delivery (access to notification logs or approver accounts)

steps.action: Navigate to 'My Schedule Change Requests' page
steps.expectedResult: Page loads successfully displaying list of schedule change requests

steps.action: Note the approvers assigned to a pending schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Approver names/IDs are visible in the request details

steps.action: Select the pending schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed with cancel option available

steps.action: Click cancel button and confirm the cancellation action
steps.expectedResult: Request is cancelled successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Check notification system logs or queue for outgoing notifications
steps.expectedResult: Notification entry exists for each assigned approver regarding the cancellation

steps.action: Verify notification content includes request details and cancellation information
steps.expectedResult: Notification contains request ID, coordinator name, cancellation timestamp, and relevant request details

steps.action: If possible, check approver's notification inbox or email
steps.expectedResult: Approvers have received notification about the cancelled request

steps.action: Verify all assigned approvers received the notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification was sent to all approvers listed on the original request

postconditions: Request status is 'cancelled'
All assigned approvers have been notified of the cancellation
Notification delivery is logged in the system
Audit log contains cancellation action record
